image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: Antarctic icebreaker RSV Nuyina has headed to deeper waters off remote Heard Island in the Southern Ocean while assessments are undertaken to see if the hull has suffered any damage after scraping the ocean floor.

title.children: Australia's Antarctic icebreaker scrapes ocean floor near Heard Island

image.altText: Interior photos of the steward's room at Elwick racecourse.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's chief thoroughbred steward was sacked for "conduct-related matters" at a race meet six days into their employment.

title.children: Tasracing sacks chief thoroughbred steward days into employment

image.altText: A man with hiking gear and sunglasses crouches in front of a cliff overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a Tasmanian man in Mount Field National Park in challenging, snowy conditions after his last contact on Sunday morning said he would seek shelter.

title.children: Search continues in 'waist-high' snow for photographer hiking in Tasmanian bush

image.altText: Hobart Clinic closure  2025-09-17 10:09:00

props.synopsis: A southern Tasmanian private mental health clinic will remain open for at least six months after securing $2 million in government funding while it explores a new business model.

title.children: The Hobart Clinic offered government lifeline to stay open

image.altText: close ups of a plumber working, with drains, pipes

props.synopsis: Tasmanian plumbers openly admit to inflating prices and charging up to 30 per cent extra on jobs in the Hobart City Council area, as "frustrating" red tape adds lengthy approval delays and costs.

title.children: Plumbers charge 'pain tax' for Hobart jobs as red tape frustrates

image.altText: A man and a woman embracing in an airport terminal.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian flotilla skipper, Madeleine Habib, has landed back in Hobart after being detained by Israel for trying to sail into Gazan waters. She says she has not given up the fight.

title.children: LISTEN: ðŸ“¢ 'We shouldn't be too easily put off': Madeleine Habib returns to Hobart

image.altText: A man with short brown hair and brown facial hair in a suit smiling.

props.synopsis: The changes follow two high-profile departures from shadow cabinet within a month.

title.children: Tasmanian senator tapped to take shadow home affairs portfolio

image.altText: Man with grey hair and beard in blue check jacket walking

props.synopsis: Independent MP Craig Garland applied in court for a restricted license, saying it would be a "terrible situation" if he wasn't able to attend parliamentary sitting weeks in Hobart due to the ban after being found guilty of drug driving.

title.children: 'I am not above the law': MP apologises for driving suspension over cannabis charge

image.altText: Smiling dark-haired Brittany in a dark blazer walks down a street, 7 news mic thrust in front, Sharaz walks beside.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

title.children: Higgins faces bankruptcy proceedings as Reynolds takes new legal action

image.altText: Dave Hughes in a video posted to social media platform, Instagram, lying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

title.children: Dave Hughes in hospital again six weeks after AFL Legends game

image.altText: Socceroos player Nestory Irankunda

props.synopsis: The Socceroos' friendly against the United States is a positive step in their World Cup preparation, while a positive result could also influence their tournament draw.

title.children: Socceroos' friendly against US could impact World Cup draw

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: The chief executive and chief operating officer at one of Australia's biggest childcare chains have resigned following a string of scandals, including dozens of sex abuse charges being laid against a former employee.

title.children: Top executives at Affinity Education Group resign after childcare scandals

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: From December, children under 16 will be blocked from accessing social media. Follow live as we explore how will it work and what the pitfalls will be.

title.children: Experts unpack teen social media ban, join the conversation

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant looking down the barrel of the camera in a portrait.

props.synopsis:
Australia's eSafety commissioner says her team has "taken Roblox to task" over its risk of exposing children to harm but warned the online gaming platform may not be included in the upcoming social media ban.

Â

title.children: eSafety commissioner says including Roblox in social media ban 'tricky'

image.altText: Aerial view of several homes and a large building under flood waters

props.synopsis: A Eugowra resident tells an inquest into deadly flooding how she put her six-day-old granddaughter in a roof cavity after a wave of water hit the Central West town, killing two people.Â

title.children: How a 'day of hell' unfolded during fatal 'inland tsunami'

props.synopsis: Visitors to a northern New South Wales wildlife sanctuary were forced to evacuate after a woman brought in a rescued sea snake, one of the world's deadliest reptiles.

title.children: 'Highly venomous' sea snake forces wildlife centre evacuation

image.altText: Kane Minion wearing a beanie with a dog sleeping on his chest

props.synopsis: After meter reader Kane Minion was fatally mauled by dogs at a Queensland property, the Coroners Court hears details about the electricity provider's work procedures.

title.children: Meter reader contractor not paid when workers skipped houses due to dogs, inquest hears

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Western Australia records its worst flu season on record, with more than 30,000 influenza cases reported this year.

title.children: WA records worst-ever flu season amid poor vaccination rates

image.altText: People walk through an covered in mud and debris from a flood

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in Mexico's central region has risen to 64, with another 65 people missing, according to the Mexican government.

title.children: Almost 130 people dead or missing in  Mexico floods

image.altText: SES volunteers and ADF personnel and a bus in sparse bushland

props.synopsis: As SA Police and the Australian Defence Force resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's arid mid-north, authorities have announced a new taskforce.

title.children: 'No evidence' during new Gus search, as police announce taskforce

image.altText: Two police officers stand behind police tape that blocks a CBD street.

props.synopsis: A man is being assessed in hospital after a string of alleged carjackings beginning in Melbourne's west ended with his dramatic arrest in the CBD.

title.children: Man arrested after alleged carjackings, dramatic pursuit in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: wrecked boat on beach

props.synopsis: Authorities say they were concerned about the seaworthiness of a vessel that left port in Ballina early on Monday and broke apart less than 24 hours later off Kingscliff in northern NSW.

title.children: 'Covered in seaweed', shipwrecked skipper swims to pub to call for help

image.altText: A man in a black suit leaves court talking on his mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Alexander Thomas Hallett pleaded guilty to winding back a total of 648,000 kilometres on the odometers of seven vehicles.Â

title.children: Used car salesman fined $25,000 for winding back car odometers

image.altText: Jacinta Allan in a blue blazer standing next to Rueben Berg on the steps of parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberals will scrap the state's proposed Treaty agreement with First Peoples' if elected. The opposition had previously withdrawn support for the proposed agreement, which is set to be debated in Parliament today and is expected to pass with the support of Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Victorian Liberals will scrap Australian-first Treaty within 100 days if elected

image.altText: An older man in a suit stands behind a lecturn with another man standing beside him, in front of Noosa council sign.

props.synopsis:
The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.Â 

Â

title.children: AI used to imitate personalities defrauds Noosa council of $2.3m

image.altText: Signage for Santos is displayed outside the company's visitor information center in Narrabri

And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: The big three of Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca remain in limbo with one day left in the trade period, with Brayden Fiorini going from Gold Coast to Essendon the main move of the day.

image.altText: A man with black hair and thick black rimmed glasses speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Andry Rajoelina flees the country amid widespread protests that saw an elite military unit join demonstrators in opposing the government.

title.children: Madagascar's president flees country on French plane

image.altText: A serious Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference, lips pressed together, Australian flag behind.

props.synopsis: The treasurer has never been afraid to venture beyond his prime minister with his tax reform ambitions, but on superannuation, he has been pulled into line.Â

title.children: Chalmers wielded the axe on his super tax, but the PM's fingerprints were obvious

image.altText: A birds-eye view of a small white aircraft crumpled in dry scrubby bushland, near by a large bush.

props.synopsis: A report by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau reveals the pilot of a fatal crash in Ogilvie likely suffered an "incapacitating" medical episode. Â

title.children: ATSB finds medical episode likely before fatal Midwest plane crash

image.altText: Tarni White of the Magpies reacts during the AFLW Round six match.

props.synopsis: Collingwood's Tarni White says it feels as though the women's competition is being used as a trial run for new rules before they are implemented into the men's league.

title.children: Frustration mounts over AFLW being used as a 'trial run' for new rules

title.children: Nathan Buckley moves back into coaching with surprise club role

image.altText: A man with mouth wide open, distressed, blood on face, arm in air, no shirt on, in bush

props.synopsis: Horror films can be a great training ground for filmmakers, but there is also a gritty reality, a panel of indie producers tells SXSW Sydney.

title.children: Indie producers spill their guts on making horror films for a living
